text: Parashorea macrophylla is a species of plant in the family Dipterocarpaceae. The name macrophylla is derived from Greek (makros = big and phullon = leaf) and refers to the species extremely large leaves (30-50 x 16–24 cm). It is endemic to Borneo, being found in Brunei, Sarawak and West Kalimantan. The timber is sold under the trade name of white lauan or white seraya. It occurs in at least two protected areas (the Gunung Mulu National Park in Sawarak and the Ulu Temburong National Park in Brunei), elsewhere it is threatened by habitat loss. ==References== macrophylla Category:Endemic flora of Borneo Category:Trees of Borneo Category:Flora of Brunei Category:Flora of Kalimantan Category:Flora of Sarawak Category:Critically endangered plants Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Parashorea macrophylla
